src:
Panteones de Mazatlán reciben a familiares este 1 de noviembre
Madres limpian, pintan, decoran con globos, juguetes y flores la tumba de sus hijos y seres queridos
01 Nov 2019, 14:39 by Blanca Regalado
Mazatlán.- Los panteones de Mazatlán comenzaron a "cobrar vida" este 1 de noviembre día de los angelitos que ya no están con nosotros.
Madres limpian, pintan, decoran con globos, juguetes y flores la tumba de sus hijos y seres queridos.




María Tirado resaltó que son 5 años de la partida de su hija y se mantiene presente en ella y toda la familia.
Marisol era una niña especial que nació prematura en problemas en su pulmón y solo sobrevivió dos meses.


Foto: EL DEBATE

Decenas de personas llenaron los camposantos; en otro tema cabe resaltar que en el panteón Jardín se encontraron que algunas áreas y tumbas amanecieron inundadas.
Asimismo la seguridad al interior y exterior se ha incrementado.






Día de Muertos


Mazatlán


Sinaloa
text:
Pantheons of Mazatlan receive relatives this November 1
Mothers clean, paint, decorate the grave of their children and loved ones with balloons, toys and flowers
01 Nov 2019, 14:39 by Blanca Regalado
Mazatlan.- The pantheons of Mazatlan began to "come alive" on November 1, the day of the little angels that are no longer with us.
Mothers clean, paint, decorate the grave of their children and loved ones with balloons, toys and flowers.




María Tirado stressed that it is 5 years since her daughter's departure and remains present in her and the whole family.
Marisol was a special girl who was born prematurely in lung problems and only survived two months.


Photo: THE DEBATE

Dozens of people filled the graveyards; On another issue it should be noted that in the Garden Pantheon some areas and tombs were found flooded.
Also the security inside and outside has increased.






Day of the Dead


Mazatlan


Sinaloa
